content:
File Control for URLs

  • Requirements

    • Functions
      • Copy, Delete, Get, Move, Put, and Rename.
    • Variations
      • Byte Ranges and Insertions

  • Suggested Implementation

    • New Methods and Headers

Previous slide Next slide Back to first slide View graphic version

Notes:

    The functions listed are from the standard set of file control functions. Due to the amounts of bandwidth needed to perform some of the actions through a combination of others in the set, it is strongly recommended that they all be given full method status.
    Byte Ranges and Insertion points are also needed to save bandwidth. These modifications should be introduced as headers which have various meanings depending upon the method they are associated with.
